newsitem.title: USA: Petroecuador raises oriente crude price 10 cts/bbl.
newsitem.headline: Petroecuador raises oriente crude price 10 cts/bbl.

text.p: Ecuadoran state oil company Petroecuador raised the price differentials by 10 cents a barrel for Oriente crude oil for most customers effective Aug 1, a trade source said Friday.
Only those price differentials that are based on benchmark West Texas Intermediate/Cushing were affected, the source said.
The new fob formula prices are as follows:
US Gulf Coast/East Coast/Caribbean WTI -$5.20 WTI -$5.30
The formula for customers on the U.S. West Coast and in Pacific Central America were unchanged at $2.56 and $2.51, respectively, under Alaska North Slope Long Beach.
The formula for Asian customers was also unchanged at Oman minus $2.50 a barrel.
Sour prices have been firm recently amid uncertainty over the timing of renewed Iraqi crude exports, traders said.
